FuncDef:
The nat bind static-mapping command enables the static source tracing algorithm and configures parameters for the algorithm.
The undo nat bind static-mapping command disables the static source tracing algorithm.
By default, no static source tracing algorithm is enabled for a NAT instance.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of the static source tracing algorithm.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 2000.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A static source tracing algorithm policy allows a device to apply mappings between a specified private address pool and IP addresses in a public address pool to a NAT instance.
Precautions
The nat bind static-mapping and nat statistics address-pool-usage enable commands are mutually exclusive.
The nat bind static-mapping and nat ip access-user limit commands are mutually exclusive.
The nat bind static-mapping and nat allow-access commands are mutually exclusive.
When the load balancing function is used for an instance, the mapping of the static algorithm bound to the instance has the following requirements:
For the maximum number (such as n) of private network users supported by a single public IP address, the value must be the nth power of 2.For the address segment of each private network section, the number of private network user IP addresses in the address segment must be an integer multiple of n. The start IP address must be able to be divided by n with no remainder.If an instance is bound to multiple static algorithm mappings, the maximum number of private network users supported by a public IP address of each static algorithm must be the same.Distributed CGN (The domain and the user group in the DAA template cannot be bound to a NAT instance) is not supported.
